items.title: In the House, Censures Proliferate, Reflecting a Poisonous Climate
items.summary: Formal reprimands, once rare, dominated the chamber’s agenda this week, prompting lawmakers in both parties to call for changes to the way the House handles such actions.

items.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene’s Resignation Hints at Divisions in Trump’s Movement
items.summary: As the president forced a onetime loyalist from Congress, her defiant departure signaled a coming debate over Republican identity in a post-Trump era.

items.title: U.S. and Ukrainian Officials to Meet Again on U.S. Peace Plan
items.summary: In the Trump administration’s latest effort to pressure Ukraine into accepting a 28-point peace plan, officials from the two countries will hold talks in Geneva.

items.title: Chicago Shootings Leave One Dead and 8 Teenagers Wounded
items.summary: Seven people, ages 13 to 17 were shot at a downtown gathering by the Chicago Theater. A second shooting left a man dead and another teenager in serious condition.

items.title: New Orleans, a City of Service Workers, Braces for an Immigration Crackdown
items.summary: Louisiana officials have been eager for a federal intervention, but planned Border Patrol operations have stoked fear in the city’s immigrant work force.

items.title: Trump Offers a Ukraine Peace Plan the Kremlin Can Love
items.summary: While President Trump at times suggested he was willing to bolster support for Ukraine, he has repeatedly accommodated Russia’s demands.

items.title: Stepbrother investigated in death of Florida high schooler on cruise ship
items.summary: <p>Anna Kepner, 18, from Titusville, was found dead of asphyxiation under a bed on a Carnival cruise ship</p><p>The 16-year-old stepbrother of a Florida teenager found dead aboard a Carnival cruise ship this month has been identified as a suspect in her death.</p><p>Anna Kepner, an 18-year-old from Titusville, was found dead under a bed on the Carnival Horizon on 8 November, wrapped in a blanket and covered by life vests, <a href="https://abcnews.go.com/US/teen-found-dead-carnival-cruise-died-asphyxiation/story?id=127759360">ABC News</a> reported. Preliminary findings indicate she died of asphyxiation from a bar hold – an arm across the neck – with investigators noting two bruises on the side of her neck. A final autopsy and toxicology report are still pending.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/22/stepbrother-investigated-cruise-anna-kepner">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: ‘This is not right’: grassroots campaign aims to repeal Missouri Republicans’ gerrymandering
items.summary: <p>A new congressional map was abruptly passed by Republicans in mid-September – but voters have a chance to rebuke politicians and stop it from going into effect</p><p>When canvassers fan out across neighborhoods, they usually rely on sophisticated lists that will tell them things like a voter’s political party and how likely they are to support a given cause. Jill Imbler isn’t bothering with any of that.</p><p>The 69-year-old has lived in Moberly – a Missouri town of about 14,000 people – her entire life. She doesn’t use a GPS when she drives around, knows where people live, and what time they’re likely to be home. And there’s a pretty good chance that she,<strong> </strong>or one of her six siblings, knows them personally.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/22/missouri-voting-map-republicans">Continue reading...</a>
